result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M Radl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court gives Defense 10 days and the State an additional 10 days to give a letter report regarding a change in Credit.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: The Washington County Case.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full.  The remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended including medication recommendations.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all medical releases for Agent.
Obtain/Maintain valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Case:  #13CM2010 was Dismissed and Read into Cases:  #14CF345 and #14CM501.

timeConds.notes: Each year of Extended Supervision to equal 40 hours.
